question: 貫く
sourceMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>pierce</kanji>, so the verb version is <vocabulary>to go through</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to pierce</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

The best way <vocabulary>to go through</vocabulary> someone's mind or a college campus is <reading>to run nude</reading> (<ja>つらぬ</ja>). So if you really want <vocabulary>to pierce</vocabulary> someone's mind and soul remember this!
